cast.overview: An original documentary that deciphers in depth, like no other before, the ten most singular years of the life of Sammy Davis, Jr. the legendary performer of "Mr. Bojangles". From 1957 to 1968, he was both at the height of the star system and confronted with a violently racist and segregated America. The film addresses the main pillars of his career and his intimate life as he pursued his dream during this incredible decade.
cast.title: Sammy by Sammy: My Tale of the 60's

cast.original_title: Frank Sinatra - Nothing but the Best
cast.overview: Not a live concert. This is a compilation of Frank Sinatra’s most popular studio recordings, digitally remastered and released in 2008.
cast.title: Frank Sinatra - Nothing but the Best

cast.overview: The artistic career of American actress Mia Farrow has been that of a passionate and committed woman who became the embodiment of a special kind of femininity, halfway between innocence and madness.
cast.title: Mia Farrow: Shadows and Light

cast.overview: From backstage magic to applause in the spotlight! Young talent Marlene Ricci shares the stage with entertainment's biggest stars in her chance of a life time, taped at the Caesar's Palace casino in Las Vegas.
cast.title: Cinderella at the Palace

cast.original_title: All Star Tribute to Ingrid Bergman
cast.overview: Frank Sinatra, Goldie Hawn, Cary Grant, Jimmy Stewart and many more pay tribute to Ingrid Bergman.
cast.title: All Star Tribute to Ingrid Bergman

cast.original_title: Frank Sinatra: The Man and the Myth
cast.overview: Frank Sinatra, aka "Old Blue Eyes," was perhaps the greatest entertainer of the 20th century. This video features a revealing, honest and intimate portrait of Sinatra, from his storied boyhood in Hoboken, New Jersey, through his phenomenal career as a singing idol to hordes of bobbysoxers and his success as an Academy Award-winning actor. See what made Frank tick, and why, in this revealing film.
cast.title: Frank Sinatra: The Man and the Myth

cast.original_title: Return of the King: The Fall and Rise of Elvis Presley
cast.overview: He had one chance to show the world he was still the King of Rock 'n' Roll. Discover the story behind Elvis Presley's triumphant '68 comeback special.
cast.title: Return of the King: The Fall and Rise of Elvis Presley

cast.overview: A documentary film about dancing on the screen, from it's orgins after the invention of the movie camera, over the movie musical from the late 20s, 30s, 40s 50s and 60s up to the break dance and the music videos from the 80s.
cast.title: That's Dancing!

cast.overview: A retrospective on the life of the legendary entertainer Elvis Presley, featuring the most significant moments of his career.
cast.title: Elvis: A Life in Music

cast.overview: A private investigator who works when he wants, lives in a beachfront estate in Hawaii, drives a posh Ferrari, runs up an unlimited tab at a swank bar, and charms attractive women in peril - that's the lifestyle of Thomas Magnum, aka Magnum, P.I.
cast.name: Magnum, P.I.

cast.overview: The Colgate Comedy Hour is an American comedy-musical variety series that aired live on the NBC network from 1950 to 1955. The show starred many notable comedians and entertainers of the era, including Eddie Cantor, Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis, Fred Allen, Donald O'Connor, Bud Abbott and Lou Costello, Bob Hope, Jimmy Durante, Ray Bolger, Gordon MacRae, Ben Blue, Robert Paige, Tony Curtis, Burt Lancaster, Broadway dancer Wayne Lamb and Spike Jones and His City Slickers.
cast.name: The Colgate Comedy Hour

cast.overview: The Frank Sinatra Show is an ABC variety and drama series, starring Frank Sinatra, premiering on October 18, 1957, and last airing on June 27, 1958.
cast.name: Frank Sinatra Show

cast.overview: The Dinah Shore Chevy Show is an American variety series hosted by Dinah Shore, and broadcast on NBC from October 1956 to June 1963. The series was sponsored by the Chevrolet Motor Division of General Motors and its theme song, sung by Shore, was "See the U.S.A. in Your Chevrolet", which continued to be used in Chevrolet advertising for several more years after the cancellation of the show.
cast.name: The Dinah Shore Chevy Show

cast.overview: Laugh along with funnyman Jack Benny as he brings his underplayed humor to TV along with regular performers from his radio show days.
cast.name: The Jack Benny Program

cast.overview: An annual American awards ceremony honoring cinematic achievements in the film industry. The various category winners are awarded a copy of a statuette, officially the Academy Award of Merit, that is better known by its nickname Oscar.
cast.name: The Oscars

cast.overview: The Jimmy Durante Show is a 51-episode half-hour comedy/variety television program presented live on NBC from October 2, 1954 to June 23, 1956.
cast.name: The Jimmy Durante Show

cast.overview: The Kennedy Center Honors is an annual honor given to those in the performing arts for their lifetime of contributions to American culture.
cast.name: The Kennedy Center Honors

cast.overview: An annual awards  ceremony honoring the best in U.S. prime time television programming as chosen by the Academy of Television Arts & Sciences.
cast.name: The Emmy Awards

cast.overview: The Frank Sinatra Show was an American musical variety series hosted by Frank Sinatra from 1950 to 1952. The series aired on CBS. As with many variety shows of the time, the show was broadcast live and was recorded via kinescope. Some episodes were 30 minutes long while others were 60 minutes.
cast.name: The Frank Sinatra Show

cast.overview: An awards show honoring the achievements of the members of the professional music recording industry. The members of the Recording Academy vote on who they think is most deserving of an award in 108 categories as specified by the academy.
cast.name: The Grammys

cast.overview: Startime is an anthology show of drama, comedy, and variety, and was one of the first American television shows broadcast in color. The program was aired Tuesday nights in the United States on the NBC Television network in the 1959-60 television season.
cast.name: Startime

cast.overview: Four panelists must determine guests' occupations - and, in the case of famous guests, while blindfolded, their identity - by asking only "yes" or "no" questions.
cast.name: What's My Line?

cast.overview: The Bob Hope Show hosted by Bob Hope, debuted on April 9, 1950. During the 1952-1953 season, NBC rotated with other variety shows in a Sunday night block known as "The Colgate Comedy Hour" (Sept. 1950 to Dec. 1955). Also known as, "The Chevy Show with Bob Hope." When the first special debuted in October of 1950 it was the most expensive television program made up to that point - costing an astronomical $1,500 a minute to produce. Bob Hope had his own television show and radio show at the same time. For the next three seasons, The Bob Hope Show was broadcast once a month on Tuesday nights, giving Milton Berle a week off. Bob ended his radio show in April, 1956. Bob Hope also had another show by a similar name, "The Bob Hope Show (All Star Revue)". In addition, he performed in "Specials" for many years. It is the longest running variety program in television's history with a record of 45 years of televised entertainment.
cast.name: The Bob Hope Show

cast.original_name: The American Film Institute Salute to ...
cast.overview: In 1973 the American Film Institute initiated its Life Achievement Award, to be presented to a yearly recipient whose talent has fundamentally advanced the film art; whose accomplishments have been acknowledged by scholars, critics, professional peers and the general public; and whose work has stood the test of time.
cast.name: The American Film Institute Salute to ...

cast.overview:
The Ed Sullivan Show is an American TV variety show that originally ran on CBS from Sunday June 20, 1948 to Sunday June 6, 1971, and was hosted by New York entertainment columnist Ed Sullivan. It was replaced in September 1971 by the CBS Sunday Night Movie, which ran only one season and was eventually replaced by other shows.

In 2002, The Ed Sullivan Show was ranked #15 on TV Guide's 50 Greatest TV Shows of All Time.
cast.name: The Ed Sullivan Show

cast.overview: The story of Elvis Presley the musical artist, a comprehensive creative journey from his childhood through the final 1976 Jungle Room recording sessions.
cast.name: Elvis Presley: The Searcher

cast.original_name: Sinatra: All or Nothing at All
cast.overview: An up-close and personal examination of the life, music and career of the legendary entertainer. Told in his own words from hours of archived interviews, along with commentary from those closest to him, the documentary weaves the music and images from Sinatra’s life together with rarely seen footage of his famous 1971 “Retirement Concert” in Los Angeles. The film’s narrative is shaped by Sinatra’s song choices for that concert, which Gibney interprets as the singer’s personal guide through his own life.
cast.name: Sinatra: All or Nothing at All

cast.overview: Daily tabloid television news show on entertainment and celebrity news with unprecedented access to Hollywood's biggest stars, exclusive behind-the-scenes looks at upcoming film and television projects, as well as the real story behind Hollywood's latest news.
cast.name: Entertainment Tonight

cast.original_name: The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson
cast.overview: The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson is a talk show hosted by Johnny Carson under The Tonight Show franchise from 1962 to 1992. It originally aired during late-night. For its first ten years, Carson's Tonight Show was based in New York City with occasional trips to Burbank, California; in May 1972, the show moved permanently to Burbank, California. In 2002, The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson was ranked #12 on TV Guide's 50 Greatest TV Shows of All Time.
cast.name: The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson

cast.overview: From the moment Sinatra met each member of the Pack to their relationships with the Mob and the Kennedys, this intimate profile reveals what every fan has always wanted to know about THE RAT PACK.
cast.name: The Rat Pack

cast.overview: The best in the performing arts from across America and around the world including a diverse programming portfolio of classical music, opera, popular song, musical theater, dance, drama, and performance documentaries.
cast.name: Great Performances

cast.overview: An American sketch comedy television program hosted by comedians Dan Rowan and Dick Martin.
cast.name: Rowan & Martin's Laugh-In

crew.overview: An impractical widower tries to hang onto his Miami hotel and his 12-year-old son.
crew.title: A Hole in the Head

crew.overview: Proposed by the President of the United States to fill the post of Secretary of State, Robert Leffingwell appears before a Senate committee, chaired by the idealistic Senator Brig Anderson, which must decide whether he is the right person for the job.
crew.title: Advise & Consent

crew.overview: American and Japanese soldiers, stranded on a tiny Pacific island during World War II, must make a temporary truce and cooperate to survive various tribulations. Told through the eyes of the American and Japanese unit commanders, who must deal with an atmosphere of growing distrust and tension between their men.
crew.title: None But the Brave

crew.overview: Set in Prohibition era Chicago, bootlegger Robbo and his cronies refuse to pay the greedy Guy Gisborne a cut of their profits after Guy shoots mob boss Big Jim and takes over. When Big Jim's daughter, Marian, gives Robbo a large sum, believing he has avenged her father's death, the gangster donates to an orphanage, cementing his reputation as a softhearted hood.
crew.title: Robin and the 7 Hoods

crew.overview: X-15 is a 1961 movie that tells a fictionalized account of the X-15 research rocket plane, the men who flew it and the women who loved them.
crew.title: X-15

crew.overview: In Johnny Concho, Frank Sinatra plays a man who goes from the town bully to town coward!
crew.title: Johnny Concho

crew.overview: A girl spends New Years Eve alone, reflecting on how she spent the previous year.
crew.title: New Year, It's Not You

crew.original_title: Happy Holidays with Bing and Frank
crew.overview: Two of the biggest musical celebrities of the 20th century come together with Christmas songs old and new in this classic holiday special from 1957.
crew.title: Happy Holidays with Bing and Frank

crew.overview: Hollywood producer Alexander Meyerheimer has hired drunken writer Richard Benson to write his latest movie. Benson has been in Paris supposedly working on the script for months, but instead has spent the time living it up. Benson now has just two days to the deadline and thus hires a temporary secretary, Gabrielle Simpson, to help him finish on time.
crew.title: Paris When It Sizzles

crew.original_title: Frank Sinatra: Live from Caesars Palace
crew.overview: Frank Sinatra was always at home in Las Vegas and this is a wonderfully relaxed and entertaining performance. Also included from 1979 is this all-star gala tribute to the "Chairman Of The Board" celebrating forty years in show business. Among those saluting Sinatra are Sammy Davis Jr, Cary Grant, Dean Martin, Tony Bennett, Gene Kelly, Harry James, Jimmy Van Heusen and Sammy Cahn.
crew.title: Frank Sinatra: Live from Caesars Palace

crew.overview: Mike, Chip, and Larry are three lusty, brawling U. S. Cavalry sergeants stationed in Indian Territory in 1870.
crew.title: Sergeants 3

crew.overview: Documentary about the star-studded pre-inaugural gala that took place on January 19, 1961 to celebrate John F. Kennedy's election.
crew.title: JFK: The Lost Inaugural Gala

crew.overview: The Frank Sinatra Show is an ABC variety and drama series, starring Frank Sinatra, premiering on October 18, 1957, and last airing on June 27, 1958.
crew.name: Frank Sinatra Show

crew.overview: Al Bundy is an unsuccessful middle aged shoe salesman with a miserable life and an equally dysfunctional family. He hates his job, his wife is lazy, his son is dysfunctional (especially with women), and his daughter is dim-witted and promiscuous.
crew.name: Married... with Children
